situation.title: COVID-Rent II
situation.meta_description: Terms and conditions of the program COVID-Rent II.

content.processed:
Contribution to 50% of the rent for the period July - September 2020 (3rd quarter of 2020)

for business entities, who had to, due to the government's regulations, in the 4th quarter of 2020 temporarily close the stores intended for a retail business or providing services to customers. The maximum amount of the bonus is CZK 10,000,000 for all stores of one applicant. The landlord's participation in the form of any rental discount is not required.

Validity

You can submit your application from October 21st, 2020, 9:00 to January 21st, 2021, 23:59. 

Rules

The grant is for sectors that have been banned or significantly restricted by Government Resolution No. 1103 on October 26th, 2020. The scope of eligible applicants does not include entities in Article I, point 8 (prohibition of off-licenses), Article II. point 5 (service operation of florists) and point 6 (service operation of farmers' markets).

Conditions for applicants

  1. The applicant must be an entrepreneur, entity, or legal person, and must do business activities based on the Trade Licensing Act.
  2. The applicant used a place which is not owned by him, based on a contract concluded with the landlord before July 1st, 2020.
  3. The applicant belongs to the defined circle of eligible applicants approved by Government Resolution No. 1037 from October 14th, 2020 and extended by Government Resolution No. 1107 from October 27th, 2020.
  4. The applicant pays at least 50% of the decisive rent (July - September 2020) before applying.
  5. The applicant and the landlord may not be related individuals, close people, or in the relationship of the controlling and controlled person. Further people acting in agreement, in the relationship where one of them uses significant influence over the other and individuals who are part of one consolidation unit.

Application

You can fill the application online via the AIS MIT information system.

The identity of the applicant will be verified by electronic identification. The manual for electronic identification is available on the website of the Ministry of Industry and Trade.

If the applicant is already registered in the system since the first call, a new registration is not necessary.
